entry.summary: ...Snow In Atigun Pass Tonight... Snow is expected to develop in Atigun Pass late tonight and continue into Thursday morning. A couple of inches of snow could accumulate above 4000 ft. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 8:09PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rapid rises along Rock and Surveyor Creek Possible... Widespread heavy rain has been observed upstream of Rock Creek and Surveyor Creek as slow moving thunderstorms produced a large area of 2 to 5 inches of rain around the Akron area. Runoff from this rain will drain in these creeks and is expected to cause rises as far east as northwest Yuma county.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 2:49PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A very moist air mass is in place across the High Plains with dew point values in the 60s to mid 70s resulting in precipitable water values of 1.25 to 1.75 inches. Thunderstorm chances increase during the late afternoon Wednesday and last through late morning Thursday. Heavy to torrential rainfall is expected which would exacerbate already saturated soils in the watch area.

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Wyoming, including the following county, Sublette, along and near Pine Creek. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
